page.title: 07Compton Church
page.content: The church dates back to Norman times. It started to fall down and was rebuilt in about 1850.It is built of stone and flint and it has a tower.Every Sunday there are services and during the week there is a choir practice and bell ringing .There is quite a big graveyard with a lot of graves.There is a tapestry with 5 scenes on it.Also there is a font probably the same age as the church with an ornamental lid.At the front of the church there is a big door with huge hinges and a very big key.Behind the door is a porch then there is another big door with a smaller door cut into it.This door has ornamental carvings on it.The smaller door is used more often than the big door.
